tool_description: Calculates turbulence intensity and turbulence kinetic energy from wind speed time series to assess wind quality and potential impacts on turbine fatigue loads.

wind_speeds.description: High-frequency wind speed measurements in m/s

sampling_frequency.description: Data sampling frequency in Hz (measurements per second)

averaging_period.description: Averaging period for turbulence calculations in seconds

error_messages: Invalid sampling frequency: Sampling frequency must be greater than 0 Hz.
Insufficient data: At least 100 wind speed measurements required for turbulence analysis.
Invalid averaging period: Averaging period must be between 60 and 3600 seconds.
Invalid wind speed values: All wind speeds must be non-negative numbers.
Data quality insufficient: Wind speed data contains too many gaps or invalid values for reliable turbulence calculation.
usage: Input high-frequency wind speed data with known sampling frequency. Use standard 10-minute averaging periods for IEC compliance or adjust based on specific analysis needs.

turbulence_intensity.description: Mean turbulence intensity as a percentage

turbulence_kinetic_energy.description: Calculated turbulence kinetic energy in J/kg

intensity_time_series.description: Time series of turbulence intensity values
